text: The Official Languages Act (1969) was passed by the government of Louis Robichaud and affects life in the province to the present day. Readers may find to be helpful the original text as well as commentary by the Official Languages and Bilingualism Institute (OLBI) at the University of Ottawa. ==References== ==External link== Category:New Brunswick law Category:Bilingualism in Canada
title: New Brunswick Official Languages Act (1969)
